text: William Forsyth Sharpe (born June 16, 1934) is an American economist. He a the professor at Stanford University's Graduate School of Business. He won the 1990 Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences. Sharpe was known for his works in capital asset pricing model (CAPM). ==References== ==Other websites== * Personal web site of Dr. Sharpe * IDEAS/RePEc Category:1934 births Category:Living people Category:American economists Category:Scientists from Boston
title: William F. Sharpe
